results.definition: the phonological or orthographic sound or appearance of a word that can be used to describe or identify something
examples: the inflected forms of a word can be represented by a stem and a list of inflections to be attached

results.definition: a category of things distinguished by some common characteristic or quality
examples: sculpture is a form of art
what kinds of desserts are there?

results.definition: a perceptual structure
examples: the composition presents problems for students of musical form
a visual pattern must include not only objects but the spaces between them

results.definition: any spatial attributes (especially as defined by outline)
examples: he could barely make out their shapes

results.definition: alternative names for the body of a human being
examples: Leonardo studied the human body
he has a strong physique
the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak

results.definition: the spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance
examples: geometry is the mathematical science of shape

results.definition: the visual appearance of something or someone
examples: the delicate cast of his features

results.definition: a printed document with spaces in which to write
examples: he filled out his tax form

results.definition: (biology) a group of organisms within a species that differ in trivial ways from similar groups
examples: a new strain of microorganisms

results.definition: an arrangement of the elements in a composition or discourse
examples: the essay was in the form of a dialogue
he first sketches the plot in outline form

results.definition: a particular mode in which something is manifested
examples: his resentment took the form of extreme hostility

results.definition: (physical chemistry) a distinct state of matter in a system; matter that is identical in chemical composition and physical state and separated from other material by the phase boundary
examples: the reaction occurs in the liquid phase of the system

results.definition: a body of students who are taught together
examples: early morning classes are always sleepy

results.definition: an ability to perform well
examples: he was at the top of his form
the team was off form last night

results.definition: a life-size dummy used to display clothes
a mold for setting concrete
examples: they built elaborate forms for pouring the foundation

results.definition: create (as an entity)
examples: social groups form everywhere
They formed a company

results.definition: to compose or represent:"This wall forms the background of the stage setting"
examples: The branches made a roof
This makes a fine introduction

results.definition: develop into a distinctive entity
examples: our plans began to take shape

results.definition: give shape or form to
examples: shape the dough
form the young child's character

results.definition: make something, usually for a specific function
examples: She molded the rice balls carefully
Form cylinders from the dough
shape a figure
Work the metal into a sword

results.definition: establish or impress firmly in the mind
examples: We imprint our ideas onto our children

results.definition: assume a form or shape
examples: the water formed little beads
